Returns: the GoogleMap. Null if the view of the map is not yet ready. This can happen when Google Play services is not available. If Google Play services becomes available afterwards, calling this method again will initialize and return the GoogleMap.
getMap().Description: Gets the underlying GoogleMap that is tied to this view.

Parameters: The callback object that will be triggered when the map is ready to be used.
getMapAsync(com.google.android.gms.maps..Description: Returns a non-null instance of the @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#GoogleMap_E@, ready to be used. Note that: This method must be called from the main thread. The callback will be executed in the main thread. In the case where Google Play services is not installed on the user's device, the callback will not be triggered until the user installs it. The @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#GoogleMap_E@ object provided by the callback is non-null.

ClassDesc: A View which displays a map (with data obtained from the Google Maps service). When focused, it will capture keypresses and touch gestures to move the map. Users of this class must forward all the life cycle methods from the @B_android#app#Activity_E@ or @B_android#app#Fragment_E@ containing this view to the corresponding ones in this class. In particular, you must forward on the following methods: @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapView#onCreate_E@ @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapView#onResume_E@ @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapView#onPause_E@ @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapView#onDestroy_E@ @B_android#view#View#onSaveInstanceState_E@ @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapView#onLowMemory_E@ A @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#GoogleMap_E@ must be acquired using @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapView#getMapAsync_E@. The @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapView_E@ automatically initializes the maps system and the view. For a simpler method of displaying a Map use @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#MapFragment_E@ (or @B_default package#SupportMapFragment_E@) if you are looking to target earlier platforms.
